item.name: NO_CONFLICT
item.detail:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Advice: 1. Although no conflict, mistakes still come out sometimes, it depends on your device, VENDOR may change AOSP a lot.
2. You could go on to run fullota, flash the outcom into your device, and then fix bugs depends on real-time logs.
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

item.name: CONFLICTS_HAPPENED
item.detail:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Advice: 1. Each conflict is marked out like:
<<<<<<< VENDOR Codes of VENDOR ======= Codes of BOSP >>>>>>> BOSP
you'd better resolve all conflicts before going on with the following work.
2. You might follow three steps to resolve conflicts manually: - compare VENDOR and REJECT to find out where conflicts happened; - compare AOSP and BOSP to find out where Baidu changes; - compare VENDOR and BOSP to decide how to resolve conflicts.
3. You might issue 'coron autofix' to resolve conflicts automatically
If you do not know the definition of AOSP, BOSP or VENDOR, type the command to see what are they: $ coron help patchall ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
